name: vector
description: Vector is a high-performance observability data pipeline that collects, transforms, and ships logs and metrics. It runs as a self-hosted agent or service and is configured via declarative files and CLI.
features: Log collection: Collect logs from files, syslog, journald, and other sources with flexible inputs.
Metrics collection: Gather metrics from Prometheus, StatsD, and other monitoring systems.
Data transformation: Transform, parse, and enrich observability data with built-in functions.
Multiple destinations: Ship data to Elasticsearch, Splunk, S3, Kafka, and dozens of other sinks.
High performance: Process millions of events per second with low resource usage.
Buffering: Buffer data in memory or on disk to handle downstream outages gracefully.
Routing: Route data to different destinations based on content, tags, or custom logic.
Aggregation: Aggregate metrics and logs before shipping to reduce data volume and costs.
Reliability: Ensure data delivery with acknowledgments, retries, and dead letter queues.
Configuration: Define pipelines declaratively using TOML, YAML, or JSON configuration files.
Observability: Monitor Vector itself with built-in metrics and health checks.
Vendor-neutral: Avoid vendor lock-in with support for open standards and multiple backends.
